events.message: Customer reported their car was involved in a collision at an intersection on April 30th, seeking to initiate a claim for damages.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial information regarding the vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to this case to coordinate the claim processing and communicate with the claimant.
The claim was officially acknowledged and the claimant received confirmation that the investigation process would begin shortly.
The agent requested the claimant to submit the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates to proceed further.
Customer submitted all required documents including the police report and photos, enabling the claim to move to the investigation phase.
The investigation team began reviewing all submitted evidence to determine the liability and assess the damage to the vehicle.
Investigation concluded with findings indicating the claimant was not at fault and the vehicle damage was severe enough to warrant total loss.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant covering the total loss value of the vehicle along with rental car reimbursement.
Customer responded positively to the settlement proposal, expressing satisfaction with the compensation and timely handling of the claim.
The claim was formally approved by the insurance authority as all terms and conditions were reviewed and met.
Payment was issued to the claimant promptly, covering the total settlement amount as agreed in the proposal.
The claim file was closed after confirming the settlement payment was received and no further issues remained unresolved.
All claim-related documents and communications were archived securely for future reference and record-keeping compliance.
